Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a quiet area of HK”
Reviews.Author: rickzwart
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel for two nights on a tourist base. The hotel is located on a 10 minute walk from the MTR station in a quiet neighbourhood of the city. So it could be ideal for sightseeing. However it could be much more convenient if the hotel is situated closer to the MTR and near a centre station instead of the terminus station. The hotel itself has rooms which are very boutique stylish. The service is great and also the included breakfast was good. At breakfast you have four choices (A la carte). We arrived our first night late at night so we ordered room service. This food was also good and not expensive. The rooms are a little bit small, but so does every room in Hong Kong. The bed was excellent and the whole room was clean (instead of hairs in the shower). The room is perfectly planned out, after every little thing a lot of thinking has going on. This rooms are so well designed. You have a big tv, a dvd player, a safe, a fridge, a desk and much more all in a small room. There is also free wifi, which was pretty fast. So, I could recommend this place when visiting HK.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest hotel room but great view”
Reviews.Author: Nabonne
Reviews.Content: Ive never stayed in such a small hotel room - its literally 6metres by 7metres with no room for luggage or clothes! Views out of the harbour view are amazing but this is the most positive point & helps the clostrophobia! Room service food was very average

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TonyJacques
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms at this hotel after a lot of research looking for a 2 night stop over on the way to Sydney. We weren't disappointed and it offered value for money as a family with 2 older teenage kids. The hotel is small and the design of the impeccably clean rooms is very clever but if you want to relax in a big hotel and room go elsewhere. We had 2 adjacent rooms with harbour views which was nice at night and to wake up to. There are 2 lifts - not one as in some reviews - which was OK. Breakfast was adequate rather than lavish and the staff were all friendly. The location is good for public transport but not exactly walkable to Kowloon ! We used ferry, metro and ting-ting locally and the immediate location is actually more Chinese than other places which we liked. Overall it was the best compromise of rooms/location/quality for our budget and we made a good choice that I would recommend to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Services with Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: alancoll
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend flying from Paris to visiting my family in HK. We arrived late, the location wasn't very easy and I have to ask the taxi driver to call to the hotel and ask for the location. The lobby located on 1/F, it was small but very stylish. At the desk, A guy with beautiful smile, who wearing alan miki glasses (Well, I work for alan miki) welcomed us. He is very friendly and paitent, explaining all the attraction around the area. And supprised he spoke good french. The room was not big but big enough for both of us. Design was cool and bed was comfotable too. After 8 nights there, check out was smooth, that guy served me again, I guess that hotel wasn't have too many staffs, anyway he is very helpful and helped us to weight our laugages. He passed me his name card but I lost it, if I did not remember it wrongly, his name is called Joseph. This hotel is very nice and warm with reasonable prices. Surely will be next year.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing contemporary space”
Reviews.Author: travelroo_12
Reviews.Content: This new hotel is absolutely great. (Caveat: I am an architect!) The rooms are small but designed so well that there is a Zen quality to the calm and relaxing space. I was super impressed by the quality of construction and detailing and the intricate use of every available space without the room feeling squeezed. The material finishes were beautiful and helped visually expand the space especially of the en-suite bathroom. Others complain about the glass door but when this permits a view of the harbor and you are either alone or with an intimate friend what's the problem? Hong Kong was also amazing. I would love to return and will do so at the first opportunity! Enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Its a great place for a single person who has work to do in central hong kong and get to the airport conveniently”
Reviews.Author: ashishvanand
Reviews.Content: I stayed only one night on my way from china to australia and was pleasantly suprises by the clen rooms and the chic look and feel. The location is great 5 mins from airport express and a 10 minute tram ride to central. The IFC mall is also 10 mins away. The rooms are tiny as one might expect in hong kong but they are great for a couple of nights when one is in town for work and uses the hotel to get a good nights rest and a good shower.

Reviews.Title: “Valuable Hotel”
Reviews.Content: Location: 10 mins can be reached from HK/Mac Ferry Terminal. Nice Location. Room: Quite small but clean enough. Staff: The front desk staff is quite polite and helpful. Breakfast: the restaruant is small but the breakfast is better than expected. The big surprise for me is that my room has been upgrade to the luxury seaview room and offered one complimentary red wine due to my birthday. Overall is over expectation. I must book this hotel again when I visit HK next time.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johan11October
Reviews.Content: this is a good hotel for honeymooners... NOT FOR KIDS..., the room equipped with modern technologies including big TV, DVD player free wifi inside the room, BUT the bathroom full of glass and see-through... with big mirror.. You have to get used to be naked or be watched during using bathroom... The hotel also provide kimono and comfortable slippers..

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kchu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our pet for a week, most of the hotel staffs are friendly and helpful, they even arrange for extra towels for our pet to ensure his stay was comfortable. The door persons in the morning should learn to smilie and greet guests as they go in and out of the hotel, as they are the 1st person guests see and also they werent very helpful with suitcases. Housekeeping will call even if you have the "Do not disturbed" sign at the door asking when you require house keeping. An alternative to this would be to leave a message at the door for guest to call if you require house keeping. In general the hotel is ok, clean and new and around 10mins walk to the Central district.

Reviews.Title: “Small & Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Wence W
Reviews.Content: You don't get what you pay for-- that's what I can say. We booked a Harbour Room and we only got a small window to see the beautiful Harbour. The service for their restaurant is the poorest I've seen. It feels like they're throwing the food at you. The worst, I have to say. Good thing the receptionists are friendly (Ben & Sheryl). We got our newspaper etc but those things are basic and included in the package. The evening tea & weather forecast for tomorrow is inconsistent. We only received our tea when we checked in and before we checked out-- nothing in between. Maybe because when we checked out, the guy handed us a feedback form. I didn't even answer it. I'm so disappointed. There's not even a frosted glass for some sort of privacy in our room. While you're taking a dump, other people can see & smell (hello, there's no door also!) it. Good luck with that. If we go back to HongKong, we'll never ever book here again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for - still quite nice”
Reviews.Author: Jin L
Reviews.Content: Don’t get me wrong the hotel is perfectly fine. The room was small as advertised but still sufficient for one person. Nothing fancy, no fluff, just the essentials. Only thing was I’ve stayed in MongKok area days before and was use to having everything very close - station, restaurants, shopping centers etc. If you are on a business trip and need to be on the island side, this place is fine. If you want to be close to all the hassle and bustle, go to the other side of Hong Kong – this place is not really close to anything. Because it’s close to the cat market, the town smelt like dried fish, even inside the hotel. The hotel itself was clean though. For what you pay for, I think this is a good little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, very affordable, good efficient staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Justythetesty
Reviews.Content: I was on business and alone so its a fine place to stay. Yes the room is small and the bathroom lacks privacy, but its clean tidy and well serviced, and perfect for a business trip, or a couple who are "comfortable" with eachothers habits. If you want larger rooms you will pay far more elsewhere. Many fine areas of Hong Kong are easy to walk to from here. Around 15 minutes of walking will get you to Soho area for example. Sheung Wan train station is 5 minutes walk away, so 30 minutes later you can be anywhere in Hong Kong almost. The ferry terminal is also an easy walk form here. The tram line is very close. I stayed for three nights, used the MRT to get to work each day, breakfast was included and WIFI was complimentary in my room. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed.”
Reviews.Author: Scallophunters
Reviews.Content: Firstly I would like to say to the people below who are complaining about the size of the room and the transparent bathroom design, that a simple research of the hotel would have informed you of those 'problems' and they are well documented. For example, me and my wife spent 5 flawless nights there knowing exactly it was going to be small and had the transparent bathroom, how you guys didn't know this is not the hotel's fault. As said before we stayed there for 5 nights and we found the hotel excellent, the rooms were clean and had free bottled water and a wonderful strong shower which is always a big bonus. The bed was on the hard side but everything was clean and there was even a nice little 'chill' couch for you to enjoy the harbour view. We had stayed in the deluxe harbour view rooms which is slightly more than the other rooms, but I think the unhindered view of the harbour was worth it. The concierge desk was friendly enough and the porters were fine also and always greeted us when we returned. The location of the hotel is also quite good, 10 minutes walk to Seung Wan MTR and there are plenty of characterful restaurants and the surrounding areas are of the 'old Hong Kong' style. For the rate that they charge you are getting a chic, clean and well run hotel that provides a very good view (in the right rooms) and providing that you are informed regarding the size and design features of the room, you are not going to be disappointed. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near Central and Macau ferry terminal”
Reviews.Author: yan w
Reviews.Content: Good Points - Staffs are friendly. Comfortable and good- designed room (mini bar and safe were hiding!) I have stayed for 11 days and they automatically allocated me to the top floor. There was a little welcoming tour explaining where were the equipment hiding. The view was excellent. The window seemed so small compared to the harbour view. Its 10 minutes from MTR station (if you are healthy and young) and trams (tingtings) are just the other side of hotel. But I am sure if you asks the staff to help you catching taxi they are more than happy to do so. Oh btw, yeh taxi drivers were smart enough to phone the hotel for direction and staffs were helpful. Near Central, the best place to shop and eat and drink and play in HK. Morning newspaper and afternoon tea Great water pressure for the shower, nice toiletories, plenty of towels, good air-condintioning, good beddings duvets (but soft pillows), bigbig tv, excellent make-up room service. Fast Wifi. And food and drinks in the lounge are delicious. (Did not go to breakfast at all.) Bad points - its Hong Kong, Room is expected to be small, glass wall of the bath room would be embrassing (but i am staying alone). Its a small hotel which is lack of facilities. Reception is small and there is no lobby for guest to stay. elevator is slow. bad pillows. But I would still recommend it if you can get rid of the glass wall.=]

Reviews.Title: “Small Room near Macau Ferry Terminal”
Reviews.Author: Debra C
Reviews.Content: As a previous visitor to Hong Kong I am aware that the rooms tend to be on the smaller size, but I was extremely disappointed with the room first offered. We had requested a Deluxe room with a Harbour View on a high floor but the room was so small that you had trouble walking around the bed. Also, there was only a glass door on the toilet so pleasant viewing for anyone else in the room (NOT)!! The only wardrobe was a rack hanging from the ceiling. We very quickly complained and just as quick was offered a complimentary free upgrade to an Executive room which was unfortunately on a lower floor. I must admit that this room was a little more accommodating but we had to keep our blinds shut as the fly over outside our hotel had a direct view in the room! The hotel is very small with the entrance only being as wide as a normal shop. There is only 1 lift to accommodate 30 floors of rooms! (approx 5 rooms on each floor) The reception is on the first floor along with the breakfast room - which was also very disappointing. Each couple are directed to a small table. These tables are all crammed into the one small room - so not sure what happens when the hotel is fully booked. You then choose your breakfast from a small menu and it is delivered along with a fruit juice and choice of coffee. We felt the waiter was very abrupt and felt very claustrophobic as people on the next table are able to clearly overhear your conversation!! You are able to reach the main attractions via tram but I would state that it is quite a distance if you wanted to walk to them. All in all I would not recommend this hotel if you enjoy space and wish to be on top of the main attractions and Star Ferry!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near Macau ferry terminal”
Reviews.Author: Timo M
Reviews.Content: Stayed for weekend during 3 nighttrip to HK. Rooms are good and fresh despite beaging quite small. Rooms have all the things youneed. Breakfast is served on tables and you only get one drink. Despite beeing little bit off the central area hotel is onlu about 15min walk from attractions. Be sure to ask room high up and not on the main elevated road side. Easy to reach with buss from airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice when visiting HK”
Reviews.Author: OZfriend
Reviews.Content: We wanted a comfortable place to stay after visiting Nepal, and the comfortable beds, cheerful service, and tourist friendly location were perfect. The MTR station nearby connected to Central very quickly. There is even a bus nearby to Stanley Market and Ocean Park! With convenience stores and many eateries within walking distance, Hotel de Edge is located well. Some people may find the room a little tight, however not all rooms are the same, and still has all the space you need. Some rooms have a harbour view as well. Breakfast was tasty and filling, and the bar served a tasty mojito.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful view,very clean rooms, friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: girafelle
Reviews.Content: every time in HK I am surprised how they manage to organise their space)) this hotel is not an exception. room was quite big for HK standards. they dont have lobby and it is easy to miss the entrance of the hotel. on the first floor there is concierge, second floor - reception and tiny restaurant. guys, try to find WCs just next to the reception. they are there but you dont see them)) pretty cool design! breakfast is not a buffet, you have to choose from several options. there is not much food but just enough. and the price is ok. everything is fresh and yummy! staff is friendly and helpful. they gave us free upgrade to the best room they had and it looked just the same as at the picture on their site. beautiful view! automatic curtains, so you can open/close them not moving out of bed. DVD player and huge TV. rooms are super clean and I just loved their bathrobes and slippers!!! the only possibly negative moment is that walls in the bathroom are made of glass so you dont really have privacy there)) but they have bathtub which is a big advantage for me!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: cloglisci
Reviews.Content: We had a great 2 nights stay. The hotel is very clean. It has a friendly and helpful staff. They speak perfect english. The rooms were very comfortable. They had a bit of an edge with the see through glass bathroom. The hotel provides you with 2 pairs of comfy slippers. The beds were divine. The location is in more of a local neighborhood. It is a nice walk during the day to Soho. The subway is about a 10 minute walk down the street. If you need a cab, the hotel will get you one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: MarvHC
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for two days with my wife. The positives: Price / value for money: for about 80 Euros per night including breakfast for two and free internet you wouldn't expect much in Hong Kong. But actually you get a very nice room with cool furniture, a big TV + DVD Player, decent toilet amenities and even a cooked breakfast. Oh and there is even a water boiler in the room and some tea bags and instant coffee. In short all you need. Location: One metro stop from Central station, right on the water, really not much to complain. It could be a bit closer to the metro but it is easily doable on foot and there are also plenty of trams going there and the stop is right behind the hotel. The view: We got upgraded for free to a harbourview room which gives you a nice view. Would I have paid the extra 40 Euros per night (that we were asked to do when checking in to get the room we got in the end for free as they didn't have anything else ;)? No, I don't think so. But with the big panorama window and the bench right on the window it was very nice. Internet: Very fast, easy to connect and for free! Unfortunately still many other hotels charge for that and the speed is very often not great. So thumbs up for Hotel de Edge if you want to get some work done. Neutral: Breakfast: You have a choice of 6 different breakfasts which are served, so no buffet. The quality was good (especially really good coffee!) but you had to wait quite some time and the quantity was not huge but acceptable. Size of the room: Well this is HK, so it is quite tiny. As a result there is not much wardrobe space, and for the two of us it felt a bit cramped. But of a couple of day it is adequate and the big window gives an impression of more space. Entrance of the hotel: Doesn't look very fancy, you could easily miss it. Also no lobby to speak of, but didn't bother me. The negatives: Bathroom: very fancy bathroom but all with glass front (not frosted!). No problem if you are on your own, but if you are with a second person, no matter how 'close' you are I do not like the fact that from where ever you are in the room you have a direct view of the toilet bowl through the glass door. No way to hide. I was as said with my wife but there are still things I do not have to see ;) We in the end created some privacy using a couple of towels. Looks like the hotel had pity with us as on the second day we found a shower curtain that could be pulled in front of the glass door of the toilet which was a helper. Still I don't understand why not at least the lower part of the door is not frosted or made opaque in some way. Ventilation system: Through our ventilation system we got a strong smell of cigarette smoke, must be from one of the neighbouring rooms. When I complained about it the only solution the hotel had was some scented room spray which helped for maybe 5 minutes... But all in all I would definitely recommend the hotel and very likely will stay there again when I go back to HK!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel nice area”
Reviews.Author: zambiamell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently and found it to be very good value for money as a mid priced hotel in Hong Kong. The rooms were not too small as in other places in HK and perfectly designed modern and clean. The hotel can be a little hard to find when you first arrive and is a little way out from Central although just 5 minutes walk to the metro. It is a nice area anyway surrounded by traditional dried fish and medicine shops. The staff were friendly and helpful. The only downside I would mention were the lifts,there were only 2 and they seemed to have minds of their own it was often a long wait to get down. All in all we would definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “edge hotel, by rhombus”
Reviews.Author: HV G
Reviews.Content: cute little boutique hotel. newly and efficiently decorated. convenient to going to the airport link. in room, good use of small space -- so one does not feel overly crowded. only thing annoying was that-- they have this thing about that even if you booked for two people staying--only one person have free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a pleasant surprise package”
Reviews.Author: dojxxx
Reviews.Content: We got a reasonably sized room (for HK where hotel rooms can be like a shoebox) and enjoyed staying here. We didn't get a harbour view, rather we were at the back looking over the backs of buildings but the room was excellent and very modern. Trendy design of the furnishings. The bathroom (including toilet) had see through glass walls so be warned if this would upset you. The dining room/bar is busy and the quality is high with good service. The entrance consists of just a desk with a very helpful concierge and staff. You go up to the first floor for check in/out. Excellent huge TV, the blind is operated by a switch beside the bed, how decadent. I agree with other posters that the elevator situation is its main problem. I'd hate to be on a top floor when the place is booked out, but given this, we thought this is one of HK island's best hotels for the medium budget traveller. We found some excellent little coffee shops a short walk up the hill and behind in Sheung Wan.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel staffs”
Reviews.Author: Jim1069
Reviews.Content: They upgrade my room to the top floor,very nice red wine and all the staff signed B'dat card on my birthday~~~ The hotel is near to a nice Dim Sum restaurant. Room service is excellent, flower tea,cookies and weather report every nights~ And one of the staff gave me a huge umbrella and carry my bags to get taxi on heavy rain~

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovepp
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and service remains excellent. This is my second time visiting de edge. Everyone is helpful. The only thing I dislike is the elevator. It took me a while to use the elevator during the peak hour. Of course, I don't blame this on the staff. Thank you de edge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base to visit the amazing city of hong kong!”
Reviews.Author: Plymguy1984
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during December 2011, the hotel is very small but well worth the price! The rooms are very nice but do agree is your not a couple you will need to be very comfortable with each other as the bathroom is surrounded by glass. Breakfast is very good, but you only get 1 free drink. Each evening they will turn down your bed and leave some green tea and cookies in your room. The hotel is a short walk from Sheng Wan station and only a short walk from Central, but i found we saw more of Hong Kong by staying a little further out from Central. And the comments about the fishy smell! I agree it does smell but to be honest it smells like this in most if Hong Kong! Its has a very odd aroma to our western noses :) There is lots to see and do, but enjoyed Hong Kong DisneyLand very much :) One thing i will say is when you arrive go to the Hong Kong tourist board in the Airport and ask them to write the hotel address down in Chinese, we used the airport express this is very economical way to get to the city fast! The only thing we found is there is normally a long queue for taxis in the Airport Express area. We found it much quicker by going upstairs, do not try and get a taxi from out side the station this is for set down only. We only found this out because of some very kind resident. If you cross the road and queue outside the IFC mall you will get a taxi in no time! And they are very cheap! And last of all HONG KONG is an amazing city!!!

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Jane H
Reviews.Content: I almost didn't book it because of the mixed reviews here and because I thought it's quite expensive, but this hotel is really very, very good - the design of the rooms, the furniture, the breakfast (choices and taste), free DVD rentals, the service of the people working there, etc. It's maybe a bit tough to find because the entrance it quite small and therefore a bit hard to see, but that's just the way it is in Hong Kong. It's not THAT centrally located because it's near the last subway station, but still: it's on Hong Kong Island and very well connected via tram and subway (just 15min walk from the center of Kong Kong Island or 2min via subway!). A couple of weeks later I stayed in a hotel in Kowloon for just a little money less and I have to say: I totally missed the Hotel de Edge and regretted that it was fully booked when I tried to get a room! Because in comparison to other hotels in Hong Kong the Hotel de Edge is very clean and very modern (huge TV with USB port so that you can watch your own movies, modern bath room, everything very efficiently designed). Will always try to get a room there when I visit Hong Kong again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - a good choice”
Reviews.Author: Holy_Innocent
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great choice for value in a good location and very clean and modern. I got upgraded to their deluxe or executive room with a great harbour view, plenty of dancing room, huge TV and bathroom with both a soaker and great shower. The biggest surprise was the great breakfast included, either contintental or with eggs cooked to order with all the trimmings ... it was a great breakfast served quickly and really added to the great value. Don't miss it - from 6:30 to 10 am. Staff were attentive and helpful. Getting to it is easy with the CityFlyer bus # A11 which is a 3 minute walk away going TO the airport or about 8 minutes away FROM the airport where it stops near the Macau ferry (be sure to cross Connaught Road going westbound or backwards from the bus direction and just keep watch for the street numbers ... narrow entrance right at the sidewalk. When you get off the A11 bus, just stay on the street level and walk in the opposite direction of the bus ... about 2 blocks distance when you see the large firestation, take the street level pedestrian crossing to the other side of Connaught Road West and turn right to follow Connaught about one block to the hotel entrance. Easy access to HK island attractions (walk or tram), Macau ferry, subway to anywhere, and the inexpensive express bus to airport ($40 HKD 1-way or $65 return ticket if bought at HK airport ticket window for CityFlyer) .

Reviews.Title: “Small but modern & good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Frank S
Reviews.Content: Stayed there recently and had read some of the reviews on here before. Firstly, it's a small hotel but reasonably easy to find as it's on one of the main roads in central HK. Just grab a taxi from the airport express station - about a five minute ride. The hotel is small but modern, with fast and free internet in the room, motorised blinds and the glass bathroom mentioned by others. Yes, you can actually look right into the bathroom - if that doesn't bother you, it's great. Service was good and staff friendly. Didn't use the restaurant, so can't comment on that. Location is quite ok, too. Next tube station is a 5-10min walk away but just hop on a ding ding behind the hotel or a bus across the road if you don't like walking. It's reasonably close to the star ferry and central hong kong attractions. If you're looking for a value for money place to stay in central HK, this place should suit you.

Reviews.Title: “Model of no-nonsense efficiency in a so-so area”
Reviews.Author: wind_n_water_01
Reviews.Content: The room is the size of a large coffin but has everything you need - it's clean, great water pressure, good Internet, full set of good quality toiletries, even some cookies and tea in a thermos will wait for you. A good harbor view if you pay a few bucks extra. It's not so easy to get to, the train does not go there, hop on a double-decker street car from the Central Station, or take a taxi. The area is full of commercial activity - small stores, warehouses, delivery trucks... Not your typical hotel neighborhood. It didn't bother me, just don't expect posh. Efficient service, I would recommend it to a solo traveler, or a couple on a limited budget.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and smart, but also really small.”
Reviews.Author: Iceman2012
Reviews.Content: Good hotel and service was really good. Two things were really bothering us: 1. the rooms are really small (we stayed at Harbour view at 32 floor), but the main problem was that the toilet door was made of clear glass and there is nowhere to hide in room to avoid seeing what other one is doing at the toilet. So it's ok, if you are traveling alone. 2. it was next to impossible to taxi drivers find the hotel, few even refused to try. Good things: - wireless internet was fast and you could have borrowed iPad from reception desk. - room was clean and house keeping did great job - price was good - A11 bus form/to airport has stop about 100 from the door. It's just 40HKD one way. Not so good: - be was really hard - room isn't meant to two people - location is quite far from everything

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and services”
Reviews.Author: Spyhotelier
Reviews.Content: I like the design of the room. They use every single space for detailed things like safe under the drawer of the bed. If you want some privacy, you may not like the opened-design of the shower place. I am ok with that as I always travel alone for business purpose. The thing that I don't like is the tidy of the hallway. I saw some clean bed sheets and towels on the cart without any cover which I may use it for they next day after the housekeeping cleans my room. The thing that I like is the service from the front desk and the bell. They are very patient on answering my questions. Breakfast is included and it's not a buffet which I really like as I don't need to complete for food with others. I definitely will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but modern and clean rooms with decent rates.”
Reviews.Author: Babemoon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very difficult to find although it is located on the road facing the harbour. It is sandwiched between dry seafood retailers/wholesalers so do not expect the most pleasant odors to greet you everyday when you step out of the hotel or into the surrounding areas. The rooms are modern, clean and stylish. For quieter rooms, ask for the higher floors. The higher the better. Not many taxi drivers know this hotel, so if they have no idea, it's good to mention a nearby one which is a block further down (Island Pacific Hotel). It's a short walk to Shun Tak centre(for turbo jets/helicopter) connection to Macau. Tram stops are just behind the hotel and is a great way to see Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Small but beautiful and economic price”
Reviews.Author: M K
Reviews.Content: I had been two times already at de Edge, and have to agree to the other writers: The hotel is hard to find, and the picture with the detached hotel with glittering front is a true lie! The hotel is new build in an old house about August 2011, but they kept the old windows, which leads to one negative aspect: If you have rooms till approx. the 10th floor, they are VERY LOUD, because a big high way is just in front of your window, which is not very well noise isolated. Higher situated rooms are much better! The whole hotel is very small, every floor hosts only 4 guest rooms, but you can also say "pitoresque", because they cared for all furniture details very well. The style is quite cool and modern! Having 4 rooms on 30 storeys leads to another problem: In "rush hour" you have to wait quite long for the lift! Breakfast is usually included in the price, but there is no buffet and ONLY 1 free drink is part of the arrangement. E.g. beside coffee you have to order and pay orange juice separately. The hotel staff is one of the very best I have expierencend in my last 10 years of business travel! Very personal, one guy e.g. speaks fluent german! Rooms are clean, and you will have some cookies every evening, with some cold (?) tea. The walk to MTR is 10 minutes, but you could also take a tram, which costs only 2,3 HKD! Good starting point for visiting HK Central, but for the price you could not expect a hotel lying in the middel of HK! (Sheung Wan is an old and original part of HK!)

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: meisdmtr
Reviews.Content: interior is great, i liked the design a lot. location is ok , but taxi drivers will never find it, as numbering is weird. but i would still recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: silleke79
Reviews.Content: Located nearby Hong Kong station, small but efficient rooms, very friendly and service minded staff. For Hong Kong standards a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong style - cool and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Yohriz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is positioned in between a row of commercial buildings where you'll find everything from luxury cars to stores selling traditional dried foodstuffs. As a result, walking to and from the hotel every day to the MTR station felt a lot like a 10 minute tour of real Hong Kong. The hotel itself is pretty new, and like many hotels in this class quite small, both in terms of room size and number of rooms. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, which isn't something to be taken for granted in this town. As mentioned above, don't expect massive amounts of space - this hotel is great if you're travelling alone (for business or otherwise). If you're a couple, I would recommend that you're very comfortable with each other: the superior rooms maximize the use of space, meaning that the bathroom and main part of the room are separated by only a glass partition, which means that you will have no secrets from one another. I'm not sure how this is with the other rooms though.

Reviews.Title: “Not functional enough, despite its modern and new rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey O
Reviews.Content: The location is 10 mins walk from the MTR station that's near the Hong Kong Macau ferry terminal. A new property so many taxi drivers have no idea where it is. The narrow entrance doesn't help. It's also just missed a motorway off-ramp so getting a taxi from the front door is a constant challenge. Bell boys were the best part of this hotel, they made the effort to run around the block to get taxis for you. The only lift from ground floor and 2 lifts in total for higher floors just aren't enough so you always have to wait a while for the lift to take you down to the lobby (on first floor). Another tip, try get to ground floor via the staircase... Insufficient staff at the "Glo" restaurant for breakfast, I was late for a morning meeting becuase a staff missed my order after having me sitting there for 45 minutes. The restaurant itself is long and narrow, during peak breakfast hours you will expect to have to share table with other guests. Food quality is inconsistent, I had terribly burnt bacon for 2 days. Other guests had similar experiences, some had wait for 20 minutes to be given a breakfast menu (over-priced, from ~$78 HKD for something very simple, but I had it included in my room). The room itself is functional and modern, strong shower water pressure. A couple of nice touches, the carpet inside the lift is changed daily to reflect the day of the week, and they will send cookies and tea to your room every evening with a little card that tells you the following day's weather forecast.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in interesting location”
Reviews.Author: cubfan22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a new addition along Connaught Road West. We stayed a week and were very comfortable during our time here. As another reviewer stated, the rooms could be a bit uncomfortable for "new" couples or friends who needed a bit more privacy, as the window between the bedroom and bathroom is clear and revealing. The service at the hotel was good, as they brought an English-language newspaper every morning and cookies and tea every night. While not directly on a tram or subway line, it was only a few minutes walk to the nearest tram and the subway was about a 10 minute walk. The ferry to Macau is also only a short walk from the hotel. The neighborhood of Sheung Wan, in which the hotel is located, was an interesting working class mix or dried seafood stores and rice traders. More old guys pushing around carts of rice in this area than young bankers in business suits. Overall, the Hotel de Edge offered a great experience and we would not be hesitant about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveltrony
Reviews.Content: Though the room was not too spacious, it was decorated tastefully and cleaned at regularly. Beware that there is a window between the bathroom and the bedroom, and a clear view into the bathroom is possible both when showering and on the loo. There are only two lifts servicing the entire building and this can cause a bit of a wait sometimes during peak hours. Overall I am happy with my stay at the Rhombus and would heartily recommend it for a traveling couple looking for a good value boutique hotel in Sheung Wan area.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever the edge again”
Reviews.Author: patrik a
Reviews.Content: Bad food, small rooms, bad location, i never ever had so little value for my money and i will never go here again. I can't understand people giving this hotel a good review. There is nothing good about this place. Don't be fooled by the pictures the reality is completely different.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel offers great value”
Reviews.Author: IngasAdventures
Reviews.Content: This hotel is new, clean and modern, with small and large rooms to select from. The small rooms are very small, but offer good value in space-challenged Hong Kong and are more than adequate. The larger rooms are quite spacious and are represented on the hotel website. The property is in a very narrow, tall building so many aspects are miniature, from the two small elevators to the lobby, located on the second floor, and the slim restaurant. The rooms that face the water have amazing views of the harbor. Located in the Western district, which specializes in dried seafood commerce, you might notice a subtle odor of fish outside, but not in the room. The rooms are very well appointed, and much attention has been devoted to using every bit of space wisely. Coming in after a long flight, a luxurious feather comforter, feather pillows and guest robes were a welcome luxury. A mini-bar, glassware and a coffee-maker were tucked into a corner cabinet. There were plenty of horizontal spaces to place suitcases and a window seat looked out over Victoria Harbor. A 40 inch flat screen TV, DVD, MP3 player and free Wi-Fi rounded out the room. The bathroom shower had an amazing amount of pressure, very welcomed to wash away jet lag. One challenge is that it can be a bit hard to find since the front door is in a narrow building among other narrow buildings. The entry leads into a small foyer, while the reception desk is located on the second floor. It’s in an area where the roadway can be confusing. In addition, it is new so cab drivers may not be familiar with it. Go armed with directions provided by the hotel and spend some time with a map before you arrive for best results. Glo restaurant, on the second floor, served an excellent breakfast, made to order, rather than the ubiquitous buffet. Ingredients were fresh, and the food was prepared with care. Service was good. This stylish hotel offers a sophisticated experience for good value. Just be sure to have good directions to get you from the train station to avoid frustration on arrival and don’t expect a lot of space. My husband and I enjoyed it and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value”
Reviews.Author: SFJohnny
Reviews.Content: Hotel has only been opened for a few months so it's fresh and modern. Rooms are small but that's Hong Kong for you...though good use of space. Bathrooms are tight but the shower had the best water pressure of any I've ever used. It was fierce! Location appears to have been an issue for some reviewers but really it's only about 700 meters from the Sheung Wan MTR station. Not really a long hike although the HK heat and humidity might make it an issue during certain months. Service overall was excellent and none of the staff could be faulted. Bottom line is you're really only paying for the room - due to tight space there's no lobby or lounge area and the only facility is the small restaurant which we only used for the breakfasts which were a la carte as opposed to buffet - again, this due to tight use of space. Bottom line is it's fresh, it's clean, and it's value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: r s
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located between horrible buildings and with it's small sign hard to find. One elevator servicing 32 floors is incredibly slow. Shows up full so you can't get on after a long wait. Dirt all over the floors in the hallways.. The smallest room I have ever stayed in. I couldn't get my bag in the room without picking it up and carrying it to the other side of the bed. No closet. A rack next to the bed and in front of the window. The photos are extremely deceiving making it look nice. Noisy. I honestly cannot find good thing to say. They claim they serve a welcoming tea. it was cold and smelled funny. I am so disappointed I pre-paid this so I can't move without losing money. But a move might be worth it. If you are looking for value, there are much nicer hotels in the city in much better locations for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise over Hong Kong Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas C
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised to find such a stylish hotel in the compact Hong Kong island. Enjoyed the sunrise over Hong Kong Harbour from the view of my room. Additionally appreciated the small gestures the hotel offered from morning newspaper to evening tea and biscuits. While set breakfast menu avoided the too often overwhelming typical hotel buffet breakfasts, adding a touch of class. Located 15 minutes walk from the metro, which is tough in the Hong Kong summer heat but buses outside are convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: The_Great_Stuartio
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly new hotel in the Sheung Wan area of Hong Kong. Normally I stay in the one of several local hotels but I was attracted to Hotel De Edge by the price. As mentioned in other reviews the room is on the small size, but for hotels in the area it is actually fairly spacious. If you want bigger rooms I suggest you stay further out - this is Hong Kong and land is expensive so hotel rooms are smaller than you would normally expect. The room is nicely furnished with a comfortable bed, a large TV, DVD player and music player. All the rooms have free WiFi One tip is to avoid their pricier harbour view rooms. The front of the building is looking out over Connaught Road which is a 6 lane elevated motorway at this point and is very noisy. I selected a room at the back which looks onto a quiet side street. I will stay here again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Small but great”
Reviews.Author: Pierrefolio
Reviews.Content: Small hotel with small rooms but very clean, few minutes from central station and modern furnishings. Some might feel claustrophobic due to the size but I found it just perfect to my needs.

Reviews.Title: “Hole in the wall”
Reviews.Author: accomodater
Reviews.Content: The entrance to this hotel is literally a hole in a wall (of buildings), and very hard to find. The hotel name does not appear prominently. My taxi driver couldn't find it, despite having the correct written address. You should ensure that you have clear directions for the cab driver. From the small entrance foyer, you take the lift to the reception on the first floor. The hotel is tall but built on a very narrow block of land, so is limited in floor space and the facilities it can offer. The rooms are small but adequate, but be aware that there is absolutely no privacy in the bathroom as both the bathroom door and the wall to the bed area are made of clear glass. Not suitable for people who people who want to attend to their ablutions in private. it is relatively cheap for a hotel of this quality on the island, but does not have many attractions near it. OK for a short stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely small room and not good values for money,go to others near..”
Reviews.Author: Jrosstaiwan
Reviews.Content: The room is extremely extremely small,we spent about -1100 hk dollar from website.the bed is small for 2 people..their website pic showed big space,but especial effect.you can see the tv is 42" and check how big the room as a reference.we live in 22f by upgrade to ocean view.we still can hear busy traffic next day morning.the breakfast is included,it is ok..just for a light meal.all hotel still in building and cannot wait to open. There is no door service ,to carry your bag...or other normal service you think that 3 star hotel can provide. In the morning, the clean lady put the clean mechine next to our door..seems cannot wait us to leave...the end of runway full of bowls on ground.all hotel still can smell glue...i will suggest traveller to spent taxi money to another hotel :marriot hotel ,island pacific hotel or ramada hotel...almost same area,but more space room..

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel with all the basics”
Reviews.Author: poohavic
Reviews.Content: Reasonable price with all the amenities you'll need. New is the advantage. Air cond and TV are all good. Bit difficult to catch a taxi in the morning and bit difficult for the driver to locate the place at night.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel with a nice view, but small room”
Reviews.Author: DBIndia
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Edge has had a soft launch in May, 2011. As can be expected with a new hotel, everything is new. This is a big advantage. The bathroom, bed, fixtures, etc are all new. Among the positives, the room was cool, comfortable and inviting. The bed was cosy. Although the bathroom was small it was clean and bright. The Hotel is located on Hong Kong Island on Connaught Street West which is sea facing . It is across the road from the Macau ferry terminal. As you can imagine the view from the window is terrific. You get to see the sea/river between Kowloon and Hong Kong island, buildings in Kowloon, the harbour to the west and the beautiful green hills of Hong Kong. It is 1.5 to 2 Km from Central so it is centrally located and well connected. The most cost effective way of travelling in Hong Kong island is the tram. The negative is that the room is tiny. Bathroom has glass door and no privacy. There are 4 rooms on each floor. In keeping with Chines tradition, the rooms are numbered 1,2,3,5. Not sure if room 5 have a sea facing view. You may want to avoid it.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel de Edge by Rhombus
HotelInfo.Address: 94-95 Connaught Road West, Hong Kong, China
